title: Identifying a Double Blind Experiment
question_text: Which of the following experiments could best be performed double-blind?

choices.text: Determine if an individual can kick a soccer ball further off their left foot or right foot.
Determine if aspirin or Tylenol reduces the intensity of pain more for a patient.
Determine if running or swimming burns more calories per hour for an athelete.
Determine if a prep course increases a student's ACT score.
Determine if subjects who exercise daily weigh less than subjects who donâ€™t exercise daily.

solution:
A double-blind experiment is conducted such that neither the subjects nor the individuals running the experiment know which subjects are receiving which treatment.

The experiment could be administered in such a way that the subjects do not know which pill they receive, and a third party is hired to administer the treatments, so the researchers who are measuring the pain also do not know who is getting which treatment.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect; the subject would know which foot they are kicking off of, the left or right.

Choice 'C' is incorrect; the subjects would know if they are running or swimming.

Choice 'D' is incorrect; the subjects would know if they are taking the ACT prep course.

Choice 'E' is incorrect; the subjects would know if they are exercising or not. Furthermore, this is not an experiment since no treatment is imposed.
